message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CC 

This paper deals with Distributional Semantic Models (DSMs) and similarity estimation tasks, which are commonly studied in the fields of computational linguistics (cs.CL) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also proposes a new measure, APSyn, which involves weighting context relevance, indicating a potential connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of APSyn against Vector Cosine, which is a widely used measure in natural language processing (NLP) and could be relevant to computational complexity (cs.CC).
